title: Textile, 1760s
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk-core threads
Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp patterning and discontinuous supplementary weft (brocading)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 101.6 x 54 cm (40 x 21 1/4 in.)
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt
description: Pink ribbed silk with two bold serpentine bands filling the horizontal repeat. The bands have a small-scale floral fill and are edged with an ermine pattern. The bands are intertwined with a flowering branch with small blue and silver rosebuds. Brocaded in black, blue, green, pale pink, and white silks, rose and olive green chenille yarns, and gold and silver metal threads.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1760s.
1760s. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk-core threads
Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp patterning and discontinuous supplementary weft (brocading). Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, from the textile collection of Mrs. Abram Stevens Hewitt. 1931-4-25-a/c.
